text: Asli Demirgüç-Kunt was born November 24, 1961, in Istanbul, Turkey. She is now the director of research at the World Bank. Recently, Demirgüç-Kunt was named as a Top 10% Female Economists, as of January 2018 for her contributions to the field of economics. This work included the Council of Economic Advisers (CEA). 2013. "Chapter 6: Climate Change and the Path toward Energy Sources." Economics Report of the President. == Education == Demirgüç-Kunt began her higher education at Robert College, earning her Bachelor of Arts in economics in 1983. In 1985, she continued her education at The Ohio State University, where she achieved a master's degree, and in 1990 she obtained her Ph.D. in economics. == Career == Demirgüç-Kunt's career began at The Ohio State University, where she functioned as an instructor in the departments of economics and mathematics, until 1988. She began at The Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland, OH, as a visiting economist, from 1988 until 1989. After completing her role as a visiting economist, Demirgüç-Kunt started her career at The World Bank in Washington, DC as the lead economist in the area of development economics. She was promoted in 2003 to become the finance research manager for development economics and serves as the advisor on the financial sector operations and policy. Now she serves as the director of research at The World Bank. She also created the Global Financial Development Report for the World Bank. ;Accomplishments Demirgüç-Kunt has worked at the World Bank for over 30 years and served as the director of research, development policy, the chief economist of the Finance and Private Sector Development Network. She is the author of over 100 publications and has many academic journals published as well. She has been the president of the International Atlantic Economic Society (2013–14) and director of the Western Economic Association (2015–18) and serves on the editorial boards of professional journals. Prior to coming to the bank, she was an economist at the Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland. ;Positions Demirgüç-Kunt served as the president of the International Atlantic Economic Society (2013–14) and is the director of the Western Economic Association (2015–18).. She also currently serves as the Chief Economist of Europe and Central Asia Region of the World Bank (2019).http://www.worldbank.org/en/about/people/a/asli-demirguc-kunt == Awards == * Best Paper Award, Southern Finance Association, 1999. == Selected publications == {| class="wikitable" |2014 |Bank ownership and credit over the business cycle : is lending by state banks less procyclical?
